title: How to Make Cocktail Sauce

steps.headline: Mix ketchup, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce together in a small bowl.
steps.description: Use ¾ cup (176 grams) of ketchup, 2 tbsp (28.7 grams) of fresh lemon juice, and 1 US tbsp (0.50  fl oz) of Worcestershire sauce. This recipe should make around 1 ½ cups (337 grams) of cocktail sauce so don’t choose too large of a bowl. An easy way to get fresh lemon juice is to slice a lemon in half and squeeze the juice into a small dish. If you are squeezing out your own lemon juice, you may opt to use a lemon squeezer, which will also help keep any seeds from getting into the juice. Make sure you remove any lemon seeds before putting the juice into the mixing bowl. You can also buy lemon juice at any local grocery store.

steps.headline: Grate fresh horseradish and add it to the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Finely grate the horseradish until you have ⁄2 cup (4.0  fl oz) before adding it to the ketchup. Stir the mixture once or twice to combine the ingredients. You can also use prepared horseradish. In that case, add ⁄3 cup (5.3  fl oz) instead.

steps.headline: Sprinkle pepper into the mixing bowl and stir the sauce.
steps.description: Use about ¼ tsp (1.4 grams) of ground black pepper. You don’t need to stir the sauce too much, just enough to mix all of the ingredients together. To add a bit of spice, you can add a dash of hot sauce.

steps.headline: Chill your sauce for 1 hour before you serve it.
steps.description: You can keep your sauce in the same bowl you made it in and place it in the refrigerator, uncovered. If you’re in a rush, you can chill your cocktail sauce for a shorter amount of time or not at all, but it may not taste as good.

steps.headline: Store any leftover cocktail sauce in the refrigerator for up to a month.
steps.description: Seal your cocktail sauce in an airtight container if you plan to store it. To keep your homemade sauce longer, pop it in the freezer, and it’ll keep up to a year.

methods.name: Making Maria Rose Sauce (English Cocktail Sauce)

steps.headline: Combine the mayonnaise, ketchup, and salt in a small bowl.
steps.description: Use 1/2 cup (115 grams) of mayonnaise, 1 tbsp (14.7 grams) of ketchup and a pinch of salt. Add all three ingredients to a medium sized mixing bowl and stir them together.

steps.headline: Add lemon juice for a tangy flavor.
steps.description: You can add 1 tsp (4.9 grams) of lemon juice, add a little at a time, or decide not to add any at all. The final seasonings are completely up to you. Taste your sauce before adding more lemon juice to make it just the way you like it.

steps.headline: Give your sauce a little kick by adding hot sauce.
steps.description: If you want your sauce on the spicier side, add a ⁄4  tsp (0.042  fl oz) of hot sauce. You can add more to give it that extra kick. You may also choose to add in a pinch of cayenne pepper to add a bit more spice.

steps.headline: Store any leftover sauce in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days.
steps.description: Use any leftover sauce to spice up your next meal. It is not only a great seafood sauce but works well as a salad dressing. Just remember to use it within 3 to 4 days after you make it. You do not need to chill the sauce before you serve it.

steps.headline: Combine the ketchup, horseradish, soy sauce, and vinegar in a bowl.
steps.description: Begin by adding 1 cup (235 grams) of ketchup, 2 US tbsp (1.0  fl oz) of horseradish, 1 US tbsp (0.50  fl oz) of soy sauce, and 1 US tbsp (0.50  fl oz) of rice wine vinegar into a medium-size mixing bowl. Stir the ingredients together.

steps.headline: Add the wasabi paste to your mixture and whisk until it’s smooth.
steps.description: Before you serve your sauce, make sure that the wasabi paste is thoroughly mixed with the other ingredients. The sauce should be free from clumps. You can always modify the amount of wasabi paste to fit your taste. If you added too much wasabi paste, add 1 tbsp (14.7 grams) of ketchup at a time to help even out the flavor.

steps.headline: Serve with cooked shrimp.
steps.description: Although this sauce would be great with any seafood dish, it is recommended that you serve it with shrimp. There is no need to chill the sauce before you serve it and you can dip your shrimp directly into the sauce.

steps.headline: Store any leftover sauce in the fridge for up to a week.
steps.description: Make sure your sauce is covered before you put it in the fridge. An airtight container works best if you are planning to store your sauce for the better part of a week. If you plan to use the sauce within a few days, a piece of plastic wrap covering the bowl will work.
